home.title: Prog. Graphical user interfaces
home.description: This website is about multilingualism. We will show you how you can create multilingual applications!

questions.title: Definition
questions.answer:
Multilingualism is the ability of a human to process multiple languages.
In computer science, the definition is that an application is able to handle multiple different languages.

questions.title: Implementation
questions.answer: Basically, there are many approaches to multilingualism. Each comes with their own special advan- and disadvantages. We explained when to use which method in our research paper (German only).

questions.title: Advantages of multilingualism
questions.answer:
A multilingual application has many advantages over unilinguar applications. These are, for example, reaching a much bigger, more diverse target audience.
Especially for big, international corporations is support for multiple languages a must have.
If you are using a content management system, like TYPO3 for example, implementing support for multiple languages is more often than not trivial.

questions.title: Disadvantages of multilingualism
questions.answer: Implementing support for multiple languages is often very time consuming, and thus, very expensive. If the product is only intended for one, unilingual audience anyways, it might just not be worth the time, effort and money.

project.title: Multilingualism
project.description: This website serves as our final exam for the course 505 - Programmieren Graphischer Oberflächen, lead by Professor Dr. König. The point of this website is to show our fellow students how to develop multilingual applications, primarily focused on web.
